patchouli.touhou_little_maid.book.catego: It's time for the maid to manage your storage.
patchouli.touhou_little_maid.book.entrie: Filter

The maid might organize the chest poorly; you can use filters to direct the maid to place items in designated areas. $(br2)Right-click the filter to open its GUI, where you can write the filter content and attach it to the chest using the item display frame.
If you do not want the maid to place any items in a particular container, use 'No Access'.
If a container already has contents when setting a filter, the maid will remove items that do not match the filter during her next visit to that area and place them in other containers.
Inventory List
The maid will proactively seek out nearby containers and record their contents. Although not always accurate, it is still useful!
You can give the maid an inventory list, and she will write down the recorded storage items and return the list to you. Right-click to view the records.
Request List

When you have many items managed by the maid, finding specific ones manually can be difficult. In this case, you can ask the maid to find the corresponding items for you. $(br2)To make the maid search for items, craft a request list.

Hold the request list to open its GUI. You can mark the items you want and use the mouse wheel to adjust the quantity. If the quantity is set to *, the maid will try to get all of the items. $(br2)After closing the GUI, sneak-right-click on a container to let the maid put found items into it. Once everything is set, give the item to the maid and wait for her to complete the task.

Upon completion, the maid will return the found items along with the list to the target container. $(br2)If no storage container is specified, the maid will put the book away and wander around for thirty seconds after completing the task. After thirty seconds, she will attempt to store the items in nearby chests. $(br2)Once the task is completed, click the reset work status button to allow the maid to start another task.

If you set a recurring schedule, the maid will store the list in her backpack after completion and re-execute the task after a specified duration. $(br2)During the waiting period, this list will occupy one inventory slot. Please ensure the maid has sufficient backpack space to accommodate list-based tasks.
Storage Define

By default, maids will access and process all container blocks within their reachable vicinity. To make maids specifically handle/exclude certain blocks, you may need Storage Define. $(br2)Storage Define specifies which containers a maid can access and from which faces. Right-click blocks to select/deselect faces; sneak + right-click to select blocks (no face data, e.g., furnaces can directly access all slots).

Right-click air to switch definition modes: $(br2)$(li)Add: Append new storage accesses to the maid's existing list$(li)Remove: Delete specified storage from maid's accessible locations$(li)Replace: Completely overwrite maid's access points (maid will ONLY use these)$(li)Replace Specific: When accessing specified locations, only allow interaction through selected faces
You can place this bauble in the maid's bauble slot or the left side of the Request List. If multiple Storage Defines are active simultaneously, they will override each other in equipped order.
Storage Manager

Select the maid's profession as [Storage Manager]. The maid will automatically collect dropped items and store them in nearby chests. $(br2)During work, the maid will view all containers within her work range and record their contents. $(br2)Note that the maid will not pick up the written inventory list, and if she picks up requested items, it may trigger a request task.

When storing items, the maid follows these principles: $(li) If there is a whitelist filter nearby, prioritize placing the item in that container. $(li) If there is an existing container with the same item, place it there next. $(li) Otherwise, find any available container.
Crafting

As a qualified helper, your maid can assist with daily tasks, such as crafting and manufacturing using items from storage. However, the maid's own abilities may not always suffice for these tasks, so you need to prepare accordingly.$(br2)The maid can perform automated crafting when the following conditions are met:$(li)The maid can locate a [Craft Guide] for the target item.$(li)The maid is equipped with a [Portable Craft Calculator].

A highly advanced automated device that helps the maid record encountered Craft Guides and calculate crafting trees based on the maid's needs. The maid must equip this accessory to perform crafting.$(#9e9e9e)$(o)Small enough to carry with you$()

A Craft Guide is a paper documenting an item's production process, instructing the maid on which blocks to use for crafting specific items.$(br2)Each Craft Guide has two input slots and one output slot. The maid will insert materials into the input slots and retrieve the finished product from the output slot to complete a crafting cycle.

To program a Craft Guide, hold it while sneaking and right-click a block to designate input/output positions. Click again to assign interaction faces. Use the sneak-scroll action to switch between designated positions.$(br2)After setting positions, fill the input slots with materials and specify the output item to finalize the Craft Guide.$(br2)Note: Crafting tasks exceeding a certain duration will be deemed timed-out failures. All items must fit within the maid's inventory during the entire process.
task.maid_storage_manager.storage_manage: Helping finding things in many chests and store item into them
tooltip.maid_storage_manager.filter_list: Put this item in an item frame outside the target chest
tooltip.maid_storage_manager.inventory_l: Give the item to your maid and wait her for a written one.
tooltip.maid_storage_manager.portable_cr: Helps your maid handling with complex craftings!
tooltip.maid_storage_manager.request_lis: Config and give the item to your maid.
Shift&click an chest to set storage
tooltip.maid_storage_manager.written_req: A notebook that recorded the item your maid has view.
